channel.title: Help getting Cheezscape running!
channel.description: Hey, I'm on my mac atm and I know it can work with java and all that. I just did stuffit expander (unrarx) with- CHEEZSCAPE_UPDATE80[1].SOURCE.rar and it made a folder called CHEEZSCAPE_UPDATE80[1].SOURCE.... everything seems to look similar to the generic hybridscape that you get when you download mopar. but now im trying to figure out how to get it running. am i supposed to use the mopar client with it or does it contain it's own client. i tried running a bunch of .class and .bat files but terminal/java doesn't like them. do i just add something to my mopar file or what lol.

item.title: Help getting Cheezscape running!
item.dc:creator: @surfer25 surfer25
item.description:
@surfer25 wrote:

just run run.bat
and then use mopar client

Read full topic

item.title: Help getting Cheezscape running!
item.dc:creator: @probullet probullet
item.description:
@probullet wrote:

Hey, I’m on my mac atm and I know it can work with java and all that. I just did stuffit expander (unrarx) with- CHEEZSCAPE_UPDATE80[1].SOURCE.rar and it made a folder called CHEEZSCAPE_UPDATE80[1].SOURCE… everything seems to look similar to the generic hybridscape that you get when you download mopar. but now im trying to figure out how to get it running. am i supposed to use the mopar client with it or does it contain it’s own client. i tried running a bunch of .class and .bat files but terminal/java doesn’t like them. do i just add something to my mopar file or what lol.
